channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Audit, export or delete personal data collected by Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to audit, export, or delete personal data that is collected by Intune.

item.title: Configure Microsoft Intune for increased security - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to improve your security posture with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Device enrollment guide for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enroll Android, Android Enterprise, iOS, iPadOS, Linux, macOS, and Windows devices in Intune. Decide which enrollment method to use, and get an overview of the administrator and end user tasks to enroll devices.

item.title: Learn about using Intune to manage Microsoft Defender settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Intune policy to manage Microsoft Defender security settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure Platform SSO for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure Platform SSO and deploy the configuration to your macOS devices. Platform SSO enables single sign-on (SSO) using Microsoft Entra ID with the Secure Enclave, smart card, or password authentication methods. You create a settings catalog policy to configure the settings. This article is a step-by-step guide to configure Platform SSO for macOS devices using Intune.

item.title: App protection policies overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Microsoft Intune app protection policies help protect your company data and prevent data loss.

item.title: Get an Apple MDM Push certificate for Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get an Apple MDM Push certificate to manage iOS/iPadOS devices with Intune.

item.title: Enroll devices using a device enrollment manager account - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the device enrollment manager account to enroll devices in Intune.

item.title: Use Remote Help to assist users authenticated by your organization. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: With the Remote Help app, provide remote assistance to authenticated users who also run the Remote Help app.

item.title: Enable MDM automatic enrollment for Windows - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Intune automatic enrollment for Windows devices joining or registering with your Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS app protection policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the iOS/iPadOS app protection policy (APP) settings for iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: In development - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes Microsoft Intune features that are in development.

item.title: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension for Windows.

item.title: Configure feature updates policy for Windows devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create and manage Intune policy for Windows feature updates. Configure and deploy policy to maintain the Windows feature version of Windows devices you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set the mobile device management authority - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about how to set the mobile device management authority in Microsoft Intune and some key considerations.

item.title: Manage Apple volume-purchased apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to sync apps you bought in volume through Apple Business Manager with Microsoft Intune. Then manage and track these apps on iOS/iPadOS and macOS devices.

item.title: Create a policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure thousands of settings for Windows 10/11, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android client devices, including Microsoft Office apps, Microsoft Edge, administrative templates (ADMX), and more. Add these settings in a device configuration profile to secure devices, and control different programs and features. Use Microsoft Copilot to get What If analysis, and learn more about each setting.

item.title: Planning guide to move to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Plan, design, implement, adopt, and move to Microsoft Intune. Get guidance and advice to determine goals, use-case scenarios and requirements, and create rollout and communication plans, support, testing, and validation plans.

item.title: Using Remote Help on Windows to assist authenticated users. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Remote Help app to provide remote assistance to authenticated users who also run the Remote Help app, and to troubleshoot for frontline workers (FLW).

item.title: Overview of enrollment restrictions - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the enrollment restrictions available in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage approved apps for Windows devices with App Control for Business policy and Managed Installers in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use App Control for Business policies and a managed installer to manage which apps are approved to run on Windows devices that you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Assign device profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune admin center to assign device configuration profiles and policies to users and devices. Learn how to exclude groups from a profile assignment in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Migration guide to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deployment guide to set up, onboard, or move to Intune. These steps include moving from partner MDM providers, using co-management, moving from on-premises group policy, and moving from Office 365 device management.

item.title: Connect Intune account to managed Google Play account - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to connect your Intune account to your Managed Google Play account.

item.title: Bulk enrollment for Windows devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create a bulk enrollment package for Microsoft Intune

item.title: Enroll Android Enterprise dedicated, fully managed, or corporate-owned work profile devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll Android Enterprise dedicated, fully managed, or corporate-owned work profile devices in Intune.

item.title: Use ADMX templates on Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog to configure administrative templates (ADMX) in Microsoft Intune on Windows 10/11 client devices. You can configure some Control Panel features, Start menu and task bar notifications, event log service, prevent IIS installation, and more.

item.title: Microsoft Cloud PKI for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: An overview of the Microsoft Cloud PKI service, available with Microsoft Intune Suite or as an Intune add-on.

item.title: Install the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to install and configure the unified Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune, which supports SCEP, PKCS, imported PKCS, and certificate revocation.

item.title: Set up Intune enrollment for Android Enterprise dedicated devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure enrollment in Microsoft Intune for Android Enterprise dedicated devices.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS direct enrollment - Apple Configurator-Setup Assistant - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Apple Configurator to enroll corporate-owned iOS/iPadOS devices with Setup Assistant.

item.title: Properties catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure Properties catalog policy to manage Device Inventory settings on Windows devices you manage with Intune.

item.title: Tutorial - Use Apple Business Manager to enroll iOS/iPadOS devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this tutorial, you'll set up Apple corporate device enrollment features with Intune to enroll iOS/iPadOS devices purchased through Apple Business Manager.

item.title: Configure a tenant-wide Windows Hello for Business policy with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Apply policy for Windows Hello for Business on devices at the time they enroll with Microsoft Intune

item.title: Set up enrollment for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up enrollment for macOS devices in Intune.

item.title: Overview of Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune - Azure - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the unified Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune, which supports SCEP, PKCS, imported PKCS, and certificate revocation.

item.title: Windows compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of all the settings you can use when setting compliance for your Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Holographic, and Surface Hub devices in Microsoft Intune. Check for compliance on the minimum and maximum operating system, set password restrictions and length, check for partner anti-virus (AV) solutions, enable encryption on data storage, and more.

item.title: Configure compliance policies with actions for noncompliance in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure your compliance policies with one or more actions for noncompliance to protect devices and your organization from unprotected devices. Actions can remotely lock devices, send email or notifications to device users, and more.

item.title: Types of certificate that are supported by Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Microsoft Intune's support for Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP), Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) certificates.

item.title: macOS device enrollment guide for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enroll macOS devices using device enrollment, automated device enrollment (DEP), and Apple Configurator enrollment options in Microsoft Intune. Decide which enrollment method to use, and get an overview of the administrator and end user tasks to enroll devices.

item.title: Learn about Intune security baselines for Windows devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deploy security baselines that have preset and recommended configurations to the Windows devices you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create trusted certificate profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create and deploy trusted certificate profiles to deploy a trusted root certificate to managed devices in Intune. Trusted certificate profiles support use of Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP) and Public Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) certificate profiles with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up the Enrollment Status Page in the admin center copy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up a greeting page for users signing in and enrolling Windows devices copy.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune to import and analyze group policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Import and analyze your group policy objects using the Group Policy analytics tool. See the policies that are supported and aren't supported in Intune.

item.title: Categorize devices into groups in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Categorize Intune-managed devices into groups for easier management in the admin center.

item.title: Understand Intune and Microsoft Entra device limit restrictions - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the differences between Intune device limit restrictions and Microsoft Entra device limit restrictions.

item.title: Set up web based device enrollment - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up web-based device enrollment to manage user-owned iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure Universal Print policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to create a Universal Print policy for Windows 10/11 client devices. The policy automatically installs printers on your managed devices.

item.title: Prerequisites for the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review the software and network prerequisites for use of the Certificate Connector for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Learn about Windows Driver updates policy for Windows devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about using Microsoft Intune policy to manage Windows driver updates.

item.title: Manage Intune devices with Android device administrator - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Android device administrator with Intune to manage devices.

item.title: Set up Android (AOSP) device management in Intune for corporate-owned userless devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for corporate-owned userless devices built on the Android Open Source Project (AOSP) platform.

item.title: Supported filter device and app properties & operators in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: When using filters, get more information on the device properties, supported operators, and supported Windows OS SKUs, including examples. Use these features to create rule expressions in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Enable autodiscovery of Intune enrollment server - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Simplify enrollment for users by enabling automatic discovery of the Intune enrollment server.

item.title: Endpoint management services and solutions at Microsoft
item.description: Microsoft Intune is a family of on-premises products and cloud services. It includes Intune, Configuration Manager, co-management, Endpoint Analytics, Windows Autopilot, and the admin center to manage cloud devices and on on-premises.

item.title: Encrypt macOS FileVault disk encryption with Intune policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune policy to configure FileVault on macOS devices, and use the admin center to manage their recovery keys.

item.title: Configure macOS Enterprise SSO app extension with MDMs - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the Microsoft Enterprise single sign-on (SSO) app extension plug-in. Add or create an macOS device profile using the SSO app extension in Microsoft Intune, Jamf Pro, and other MDM solution providers.

item.title: Restrict devices features using policy in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add a device configuration profile to restrict features on Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, AOSP, macOS, iOS, iPadOS, and Windows 10/11 client devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create a Wi-Fi profile for devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the steps to create a Wi-Fi device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune. Create profiles for Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, Android kiosk, iOS, iPadOS, macOS, Windows 10/11, and Windows Holographic for Business. Use these profiles to create a WiFi connection to use certificates, choose an EAP type, select an authentication method, enable a proxy, and more.

item.title: Manage and secure devices overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get an overview of the concepts and features you should know when managing devices that access organization resources in Microsoft Intune. You can manage new and existing devices, including BYOD personal devices, check health compliance and view reports, configure device features, and secure devices using mobile threat solutions.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the recommended processes to manage macOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use the settings catalog to configure DDM software updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure Apple's declarative device management (DDM) settings to install a specific update by an enforced deadline. This feature uses the settings catalog to configure managed software updates for supervised iOS/iPadOS and managed macOS devices.

item.title: Shared or multi-user Windows device settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add and use Windows 10/11 and Windows Holographic for Business devices that are shared, or used by multiple users in Microsoft Intune. See a list of all the settings and what they do on the devices, including Microsoft HoloLens. Control guest accounts, manage accounts and delete inactive accounts, allow or prevent saving to local storage, set power and sleep options, choose when updates are installed, and use devices in education environments in a device configuration profile.

item.title: Add groups to organize users and devices for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create Microsoft Entra groups to organize users and devices for use with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use Microsoft Defender for Endpoint in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Microsoft Intune as a Mobile Threat Defense solution.

item.title: PowerShell scripts for Remediations - Microsoft Intune
item.description: PowerShell script reference for Remediations.

item.title: Device features and settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Overview of the different Microsoft Intune device profiles. Get info on GPO, features, restrictions, email, wifi, VPN, education, certificates, upgrade Windows 10/11, BitLocker and Microsoft Defender, and custom device configuration settings in the Microsoft Intune admin center. Use these profiles to manage and protect data and devices in your company.

item.title: Set up Android (AOSP) device management in Intune for corporate-owned user-associated devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for corporate-owned user-associated devices built on the Android Open Source Project (AOSP) platform.

item.title: Enroll personal devices in Intune with Android Enterprise work profile management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for personal devices and bring-your-own-device scenarios using Android Enterprise work profile management.

item.title: Update Windows BIOS using configuration MDM policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the BIOS configuration profile that can manage traditional BIOS settings in Microsoft Intune. You use an OEM tool to create a configuration file with the settings. You deploy an OEM Win32 app to the devices to read the configuration file and BIOS passwords. Then, you create a BIOS configuration policy in Intune to add the configuration file and assign the policy to your devices.

item.title: Set up Android Enterprise work profile for corporate owned devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Android Enterprise work profile for corporate-owned devices enrolling in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up automatic enrollment in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Intune automatic enrollment of Windows 10/11 devices that join or register with your Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: Learn about the Microsoft Tunnel VPN solution for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway, a VPN server for Intune that runs on Linux. With Microsoft Tunnel, cloud-based devices you manage with Intune can reach your on-premises infrastructure.

item.title: Add VPN settings to devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: On Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and Windows devices, use built-in settings to create virtual private network (VPN) connections in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Join your cloud-native endpoints to Microsoft Entra
item.description: When moving to or using cloud-native endpoints, use Microsoft Entra joined endpoints. When your endpoints are joined to Microsoft Entra, you can use Windows Autopilot to provision or get devices ready for organization use. Learn more about the benefits to IT admins and end-users.

item.title: Overview of Apple device enrollment in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Utilize Apple device enrollment to enroll and manage user-owned iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Using Azure Virtual Desktop single-session with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Guidelines for using Azure Virtual Desktop single-session with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Third-party device compliance partners support in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use a third-party device compliance partner as a source of compliance data for devices you manage with Intune.

item.title: Set up device-based Conditional Access policies with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure a device-based Conditional Access policy that uses device status from a Microsoft Intune device compliance policies.

item.title: Authentication methods for Apple automated device enrollment - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes the Intune-supported authentication methods you can use with automated device enrollment.

item.title: Require multifactor authentication for Intune device enrollment - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to require multifactor authentication in Microsoft Entra ID for Intune device enrollment.

item.title: High-level architecture for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This reference architecture shows options for integrating Microsoft Intune in your Azure environment with Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune policies to manage macOS software updates - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage system updates for supervised macOS devices.

item.title: Deployment guide to manage Android devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the recommended processes to manage Android devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS device compliance settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the device compliance settings for iOS/iPadOS that you can manage with Microsoft Intune compliance policies.

item.title: Automatically enroll devices with Samsung Knox Mobile Enrollment - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll Android devices in Microsoft Intune with the Knox Mobile Enrollment tool.

item.title: Manage and secure apps overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get an overview of the concepts and features you should know when managing apps that access organization resources in Microsoft Intune. You can deploy apps used by your organization, including Microsoft Edge and Microsoft 365. You can also configure apps, protect apps on organizations owned and BYOD personal devices, and update apps that you deploy.

item.title: Set up user enrollment with Company Portal for iOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up the profile based Apple User Enrollment option for personal devices enrolling in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Windows Antivirus policy settings for Microsoft Defender Antivirus for Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of the settings in the Microsoft Defender Antivirus profile for Windows devices. You can configure these settings as part of Endpoint security Antivirus policy in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Settings list for the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the settings in the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint and each settings default value.

item.title: Route logs to Azure Monitor using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Diagnostics Settings to send audit logs and operational logs in Microsoft Intune to Azure Storage account, Event Hubs, or Log Analytics. Choose how long you want to keep the data, and see some estimated costs for different size tenants.

item.title: Scenarios for using Conditional Access with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Conditional Access is commonly used with Intune compliance policy for devices and apps

item.title: Migrate your imported group policy to a policy in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: After you import your Windows group policy objects in Microsoft Intune, use the migrate feature to transfer your GPOs to a Settings Catalog policy. This policy uses your imported GPOs, and can be assigned to users and devices managed by your organizations.

item.title: Create discovery scripts for custom compliance policy in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create scripts for Linux or Windows devices to discover the settings you define as custom compliance settings for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Kiosk settings for Windows and Holographic devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure your Windows 10/11 and Windows Holographic for Business devices as single-app and multi-app kiosks, customize the start menu, add apps, show the task bar, and configure a web browser in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: View report details for encryption status of devices managed with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune admin center to view reports for device encryption status across macOS FileVault and Windows BitLocker encrypted devices that you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use app-based Conditional Access policies with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about using app-based Conditional Access policies with Microsoft Intune for both enrolled and unenrolled devices.

item.title: Create Windows Driver updates policy in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to manage policies that install Windows driver updates on your Intune managed Windows devices.

item.title: Using Windows virtual machines with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the general guidelines for using Windows 10/11 virtual machines with Microsoft Intune

item.title: Set up per-app VPN for iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the prerequisites, create a group for the virtual private network (VPN) users, add a SCEP certificate profile, configure a per-app VPN profile, and assign some apps to the VPN profile in Microsoft Intune on iOS/iPadOS devices. Also lists the steps to verify the VPN connection on the device.
